title: Riverfront Structural Design
shortDescription: Introduces structural analysis for bridges, piers, and levees in dynamic river settings.
fullDescription: Students learn structural engineering fundamentals with emphasis on hydrodynamic loading, soil-structure interaction, and resilient materials for riverfront projects.

title: Adaptive Bridge Engineering
shortDescription: Explores adjustable bridge systems responding to tidal and shipping constraints.
fullDescription: Learners prototype movable structures, analyze actuator systems, and evaluate lifecycle maintenance for adaptive bridges across river corridors.

title: Tidal Hydraulics Laboratory
shortDescription: Applies experimental methods to simulate tidal flows and turbulence.
fullDescription: Students operate scale models, deploy instrumentation, and analyze datasets to optimize tidal channel and levee configurations.

title: Circular Water Systems Engineering
shortDescription: Designs closed-loop water systems for industrial and community reuse.
fullDescription: The course addresses water-energy nexus, membrane technologies, and policy frameworks enabling circular water economies.

title: Autonomous Fabrication Workshop
shortDescription: Integrates robotics and additive manufacturing for riverfront construction.
fullDescription: Participants program robotic arms, evaluate composite materials, and deliver prototypes for rapid-response infrastructure.

title: River Mobility Systems Design
shortDescription: Develops multimodal transport plans integrating ferry, rail, and cycling networks.
fullDescription: Students collaborate with transit agencies to optimize timetables, design passenger experiences, and ensure equitable access across riverfront districts.

title: Resilient Materials Laboratory
shortDescription: Evaluates material durability under extreme moisture, salinity, and heat conditions.
fullDescription: This advanced lab features accelerated weathering chambers and digital material tracking to inform infrastructure procurement.

title: Port Logistics Engineering
shortDescription: Optimizes cargo, passenger, and supply chain flows through river-port systems.
fullDescription: Learners model logistics operations, design smart berths, and evaluate decarbonized port strategies aligned with community needs.

title: Estuary Biodiversity Survey
shortDescription: Field-intensive introduction to estuary species identification and sampling.
fullDescription: Students conduct transects, use environmental DNA, and catalog species to inform conservation strategies.

title: River Chemistry Analytics
shortDescription: Covers advanced analytical methods for tracking river pollutants and nutrients.
fullDescription: Learners calibrate instruments, interpret chromatograms, and design monitoring dashboards for stakeholders.

title: Atmospheric Optics of River Basins
shortDescription: Explores light scattering, aerosols, and visibility across humid regions.
fullDescription: Students analyze satellite data, run radiative transfer models, and assess public health impacts.

title: Quantum Sensor Applications
shortDescription: Introduces quantum sensing devices for environmental monitoring.
fullDescription: Learners prototype magnetometers and photon detectors to capture micro-changes in riverine systems.

title: Hydrologic Modeling Studio
shortDescription: Builds integrated models to forecast watershed responses under climate stress.
fullDescription: Teams combine GIS, hydrologic software, and scenario planning to support municipal decision-making.

title: Coastal Genomics
shortDescription: Examines genomic diversity across coastal and estuary species.
fullDescription: Students conduct sequencing, interpret genomic markers, and design conservation recommendations.

title: Sediment Dynamics Field Camp
shortDescription: Immersive field course analyzing sediment flows and geomorphology.
fullDescription: Participants deploy sensors, map riverbeds, and provide recommendations for dredging and restoration projects.

title: Climate Resilience Modeling
shortDescription: Advanced seminar on integrated climate impact modeling across river basins.
fullDescription: Doctoral students collaborate with policy makers to align adaptation modeling with equity metrics and finance planning.

title: River Sketching Studio
shortDescription: Foundation drawing course capturing river landscapes and communities.
fullDescription: Students practice observational techniques, experiment with mixed media, and produce an illustrated river atlas.

title: Heritage Documentation Techniques
shortDescription: Trains students in archival research, oral histories, and digital preservation.
fullDescription: Learners develop community trust, record oral histories, and digitize artifacts to support heritage exhibits.

title: Multilingual Storytelling
shortDescription: Explores translation, interpretation, and narrative craft across river languages.
fullDescription: Students compose multilingual scripts, develop translation glossaries, and produce live storytelling events.

title: Documentary Production Field Lab
shortDescription: Immersive experience capturing documentary films about river life.
fullDescription: Teams plan shoots, manage audio, edit footage, and publish short films highlighting community innovation.

title: Public Art Installations
shortDescription: Designs large-scale public art responding to river ecologies.
fullDescription: Students prototype sculptures, collaborate with engineers, and develop permits for installation.

title: River Cultural Theory
shortDescription: Seminar interrogating river-based cultural identities and expressions.
fullDescription: Participants engage with cultural theory, analyze artworks, and produce critical essays and podcasts.

title: Immersive Media Narratives
shortDescription: Advanced project-based course using AR/VR to tell river stories.
fullDescription: Students design interactive experiences, integrate spatial audio, and deploy prototypes for community feedback.

title: Sustainable Venture Foundations
shortDescription: Covers entrepreneurship fundamentals for mission-driven startups.
fullDescription: Students develop business models, impact metrics, and investor pitches focused on river-positive ventures.

title: Impact Finance Modeling
shortDescription: Teaches financial modeling for sustainable infrastructure investment.
fullDescription: Learners analyze cash flows, blended finance, and risk scenarios for equitable river projects.

title: Civic Leadership Lab
shortDescription: Immersive leadership development with civic agencies.
fullDescription: Students design community engagement plans, facilitate workshops, and evaluate leadership styles.

title: River Tourism Management
shortDescription: Focuses on sustainable hospitality and tourism experiences.
fullDescription: Learners craft itineraries, manage operations, and integrate cultural storytelling for river destinations.

title: Social Innovation Studio
shortDescription: Team-based studio developing scalable social enterprises.
fullDescription: Students partner with nonprofits to co-create solutions, test prototypes, and develop financial sustainability plans.

title: Supply Chain Strategies for Delta Regions
shortDescription: Analyzes logistics networks serving river delta economies.
fullDescription: Learners use simulation tools to design resilient supply chains for agriculture, manufacturing, and emergency response.

title: Strategic Water Policy
shortDescription: Executive-level seminar bridging business, policy, and community goals.
fullDescription: Participants evaluate policy instruments, develop corporate water stewardship strategies, and advise fictional governments.

title: Integrated Health Sciences
shortDescription: Foundational biomedical sciences for medical trainees.
fullDescription: Students integrate anatomy, physiology, and pathology with river-related health case studies.

title: River Clinic Practicum
shortDescription: Clinical rotation aboard mobile river health units.
fullDescription: Learners deliver care, conduct screenings, and coordinate telehealth consults for river settlements.

title: Community Epidemiology
shortDescription: Investigates disease patterns linked to water quality and access.
fullDescription: Students conduct surveillance, analyze outbreaks, and propose interventions for vulnerable river populations.

title: Advanced Nursing Simulation
shortDescription: High-fidelity simulations covering emergency and chronic care scenarios.
fullDescription: Participants manage interdisciplinary teams, document care, and evaluate patient outcomes in immersive labs.

title: Biomedical Device Design
shortDescription: Interdisciplinary studio designing low-cost diagnostics.
fullDescription: Teams collaborate with engineers to prototype devices for remote health contexts and develop regulatory pathways.

title: Telehealth for Remote Communities
shortDescription: Implements telehealth platforms to extend care across river regions.
fullDescription: Learners evaluate digital tools, design workflows, and measure impact of telehealth interventions.

title: Clinical Diagnostics Seminar
shortDescription: Doctoral seminar on complex diagnostics and personalized care.
fullDescription: Participants review advanced cases, integrate AI tools, and publish collaborative research briefs.

title: Public Health Leadership Residency
shortDescription: Residency program embedding students in health agencies.
fullDescription: Doctoral candidates lead projects on policy reform, resource allocation, and emergency preparedness.

title: Inclusive Curriculum Design
shortDescription: Develops equitable curriculum frameworks for diverse classrooms.
fullDescription: Students co-create lesson plans with local schools, integrating river cultures and universal design principles.

title: Learning Analytics for Schools
shortDescription: Applies analytics to improve teaching and student outcomes.
fullDescription: Learners interpret dashboards, design interventions, and protect student data privacy.

title: River Youth Counseling
shortDescription: Prepares counselors to support youth navigating climate transitions.
fullDescription: Students practice counseling techniques, coordinate referrals, and design culturally responsive programming.

title: Outdoor Learning Pedagogy
shortDescription: Designs experiential learning programs along river habitats.
fullDescription: Participants plan outdoor curricula, assess safety, and integrate STEM storytelling.

title: Leadership for Principals
shortDescription: Prepares aspiring principals for transformational leadership.
fullDescription: Students develop strategic plans, manage budgets, and lead inclusive school communities.

title: Student Wellness Practicum
shortDescription: Applies counseling strategies in school wellness centers.
fullDescription: Learners provide supervised counseling, coordinate services, and evaluate program outcomes.

title: Educational Policy Analysis
shortDescription: Doctoral seminar on policy design and evaluation for river regions.
fullDescription: Students conduct policy research, brief stakeholders, and publish recommendations on equitable schooling.

title: Foundations of Water Law
shortDescription: Introduces water rights, allocation frameworks, and legal history.
fullDescription: Students analyze riparian doctrines, case law, and international treaties shaping river governance.

title: Community Advocacy Workshop
shortDescription: Equips students with advocacy skills for community-based legal projects.
fullDescription: Teams work with river neighborhoods to co-develop legal strategies addressing housing and environmental challenges.

title: Indigenous Sovereignty Law
shortDescription: Examines sovereignty, treaty law, and indigenous water rights.
fullDescription: Students work alongside tribal legal teams to analyze treaties, develop briefs, and propose restorative policies.

title: Environmental Justice Clinic
shortDescription: Clinical course supporting communities facing environmental inequities.
fullDescription: Students litigate mock cases, craft policy recommendations, and coordinate with scientists.

title: River Negotiation Strategies
shortDescription: Advanced seminar on multi-party negotiation for river resources.
fullDescription: Learners deploy scenario planning, facilitate dialogues, and draft compacts balancing stakeholders.

title: Maritime Regulation and Trade
shortDescription: Analyzes maritime law, shipping compliance, and port governance.
fullDescription: Students interpret international codes, advise fictional port authorities, and develop compliance programs.

title: Comparative River Governance
shortDescription: Doctoral seminar comparing governance models across global rivers.
fullDescription: Participants analyze legal, cultural, and economic dimensions, producing policy white papers for fictional governments.

title: Programming for River Systems
shortDescription: Introduces programming with projects focused on sensor and data integration.
fullDescription: Students build data pipelines, interface with sensors, and visualize outputs for water monitoring.

title: Data Visualization Studio
shortDescription: Designs compelling data stories for civic audiences.
fullDescription: Students create dashboards, interactive maps, and narrative reports for river policy teams.

title: Machine Learning for Climate
shortDescription: Applies machine learning to climate resilience challenges.
fullDescription: Learners build predictive models for flooding, heat islands, and water quality using open datasets.

title: Cybersecurity Foundations
shortDescription: Covers fundamentals of securing critical digital infrastructure.
fullDescription: Students analyze threat models, configure defenses, and practice incident response for water utilities.

title: Smart Mobility Analytics
shortDescription: Applies data science to mobility networks and autonomous systems.
fullDescription: Students ingest transit data, optimize routes, and prototype decision tools for multimodal mobility.

title: AI Ethics for Civic Systems
shortDescription: Examines ethical frameworks and governance for civic AI deployments.
fullDescription: Learners critique algorithmic systems, draft governance charters, and facilitate community dialogues.

title: Immersive Interface Design
shortDescription: Designs AR/VR interfaces for education and urban planning.
fullDescription: Students prototype immersive experiences, evaluate usability, and integrate data overlays for stakeholders.

title: Advanced Privacy Engineering
shortDescription: Doctoral-level exploration of privacy-preserving data systems.
fullDescription: Participants design privacy architectures, implement differential privacy, and conduct audits for civic datasets.
